Classes

struct  ZoomRange

Detailed Description

Zoom specification class for overlay items.

Used to configure the zoom specific visual representation for overlay items. Used when creating an OverlayItem.

Member Function Documentation

void WFAPI::OverlayItemZoomSpec::addZoomLevelRange ( wf_uint32  minZoom,
wf_uint32  maxZoom,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  normalSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  stackedSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  normalTappedSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  stackedTappedSpec 
)

Add zoom level range with the given OverlayItemVisualSpecs. If several calls are made with overlapping ranges, which specification to be used at such a range is undefined. If the overlay item is highlighted and a highlight specification has been set, it will be used instead. If an item is being tapped and a set of tapped visual specifications are supplied, it will be used instead. It is possible to use the same visual specification for all different states.

Parameters:
minZoom The lower level of zoom of which rangeSpec will be used.
maxZoom The upper level of zoom of which rangeSpec will be used.
normalSpec The visual specification that will be used for the normal state.
stackedSpec The visual specification that will be used for the stacked state.
normalTappedSpec The visual specification that will be used for the normal state when being tapped.
stackedTappedSpec The visual specification that will be used for the stacked state when being tapped.

void WFAPI::OverlayItemZoomSpec::addZoomLevelRange ( wf_uint32  minZoom,
wf_uint32  maxZoom,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  normalSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  stackedSpec 
)

Add zoom level range with the given OverlayItemVisualSpec. If several calls are made with overlapping ranges, which specification to be used at such a range is undefined. If the overlay item is highlighted and a highlight specification has been set, it will be used instead. It is possible to use the same visual specification for the normal and stacked states.

Parameters:
minZoom The lower level of zoom of which rangeSpec will be used.
maxZoom The upper level of zoom of which rangeSpec will be used.
normalSpec The visual specification that will be used for the normal state.
stackedSpec The visual specification that will be used for the stacked state.

static OverlayItemZoomSpec* WFAPI::OverlayItemZoomSpec::allocate (  )  [static]

Allocates a new zoom specification. All instantiation is taken care of here so that it will not be stack allocated.

Initially the reference count will be set to 1. Once you are done with this object, you will need to call removeReference to ensure that the object is properly deallocated.

const OverlayItemVisualSpec* WFAPI::OverlayItemZoomSpec::getNormalHighlightedSpec (  )  const

The visual spec that is used for the normal state when the item is highlighted.

void WFAPI::OverlayItemZoomSpec::setHighlightedSpecs ( const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  normalSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  stackedSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  normalTappedSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  stackedTappedSpec 
)

Set the visual specification for highlighted items for normal and stacked states, including specific visual specifications for when the items are being tapped.

Parameters:
normalSpec The visual spec that is used for the normal state.
stackedSpec The visual spec that is used for the stacked state.
normalTappedSpec The visual spec that is used for the normal state when the item is being tapped.
stackedTappedSpec The visual spec that is used for the stacked state when the item is being tapped.

void WFAPI::OverlayItemZoomSpec::setHighlightedSpecs ( const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  normalSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  stackedSpec 
)

Set the visual specification for highlighted items for normal and stacked states.

Parameters:
normalSpec The visual spec that is used for the normal state.
stackedSpec The visual spec that is used for the stacked state.
